text: Harry Rowohlt (27 March 1945 – 15 June 2015) was a German writer and translator. He was born in Hamburg. He also played the role of a derelict in the famous German weekly-soap Lindenstraße. In 1999 he was awarded the Johann- Heinrich-Voß-Preis für Übersetzung. And in 2005, he received the Deutscher Jugendliteraturpreis for his translation work. He died of lung cancer in Hamburg. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Germany Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Writers from Hamburg Category:German translators
title: Harry Rowohlt
